== Welcome! ==
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, MykeSoBe!
[[Image:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' about the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[Wikibooks:Reading room/General|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what [[Wikibooks:Reading room/Projects|interests you]]. If you're coming here from other Wikimedia projects, you should read [[Help:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|our primer for Wikimedians]] to get quickly up-to-speed.
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* See the '''Wikibooks [[Help:Contents|help pages]]''' for common issues, or read [[Using Wikibooks]] for a more user-friendly introduction to the project. * Remember, every edit is saved, so if you make mistakes, you can [[Wikibooks:Reverting|revert]] to an earlier version if needed. * Get help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Files must be uploaded to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]], unless they are copyrighted and need to be uploaded here under [[w:fair use|fair use]]. If you need to upload a fair use file, you may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to do so. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:FILES|license tag]] and source are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}.
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[:w:Help:Edit summary|the edit summary]] and [[Help:Show preview|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[Help:Talk page|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only becomes available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
Thanks, --[[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]] 12:30, 20 March 2010 (UTC)
(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
For new books we like to put the contents on the main page, for easier navigation and linking. When you view a subpage you'll see that automatic link to the root at the top; clicking that lets you jump right to the contents then without having to go down a level again for a contents page that is placed on a subpage rather than the root. Good luck with the book! -- [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]] 00:09, 21 March 2010 (UTC) :Oh, and I've moved your question on the book page to the talk page - it's better [[Talk:Pizzonese|here]] really. Don't worry about "rules", style points are more guidelines and people will help out if you aren't clear on normal practice with some advice. [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 00:11, 21 March 2010 (UTC)

[[Category:Alternative medicine]]

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lavender

revision.text: [[File:Lavandula angustifolia090718.jpg|right|200px|''Lavandula angustifolia'' flowers]] ;Lavender (''Lavandula angustifolia'') Lavender is a very useful and popular essential oil. It comes from the flower tops of ''Lavandula angustifolia'' (''Lavandula officinalis'') plants and is extracted by steam distillation. It has a flowery scent and a balancing effect on the body and mind. ==Properties== [[File:LavenderEssentialOil.png|right|150px|Bottle of lavender oil]] ===Circulatory=== May lower blood pressure and reduce fluid retention. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, nausea, vomiting and flatulence. Soothes colic. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Helps calm panic and hysteria. Alleviates insomnia. ===Gynecological=== Regulates the menstrual cycle. Eases symptoms of premenstrual syndrome. ===Immunological=== Helps fight throat infections. ===Pain=== Alleviates arthritis, rheumatism, headaches and migraine. Soothes muscle pain. ===Respiratory=== Relieves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Asthma|asthma]], bronchitis, laryngitis, catarrh and symptoms of a cold. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], psoriasis, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]], dandruff, oily skin and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Athlete's foot|athlete's foot]]. Promotes healing of abscesses, minor wounds, sunburn and burns. It can be applied neat to the skin and is very effective on minor burns. ===Other uses=== Repels insects. ==Caution== *Don't use lavender oil during the early stages of pregnancy. ==Blending== Lavender can be combined with clary sage, frankincense, geranium, cedarwood, pine, nutmeg and citrus oils. {{Wikipedia|Lavandula angustifolia}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

== Risk taking (alpha = ?) == === Items ===
*Taking gambles is part of our strategy for success. *We take above-average risks in our business. *Taking chances is an element of our business strategy. *Our strategy can be characterized by a strong tendency to take risks.
=== Source ===
*Jambulingam/Kathuria/Doucette (2005): Entrepreneurial orientation as a basis for classification within a service industry: the case of retail pharmacy industry. Journal of Operations Management, Vol. 23, No. 1, pp. 23-42.
== Related Scales ==
*[[Handbook of Management Scales/Firm risk preference|Firm risk preference]] *[[Handbook of Management Scales/Risk aversion|Risk aversion]]
{{BookCat}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Peppermint

revision.text:
[[File:Peppermint closeup.jpg|right|150px|''Mentha √ó piperita'' leaves]] ;Peppermint (''Mentha √ó piperita'') Peppermint oil comes from the leaves of ''Mentha √ó piperita'' (also known as ''Mentha balsamea''). It is particularly used for healing the digestive system. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, nausea, heartburn, flatulence and diarrhea. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Relieves fatigue and improves concentration. ===Gynecological=== Reduces menstrual pain. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, coughs, bronchitis and sinusitis. ==Caution== *Don't use peppermint oil during pregnancy. *Don't use on young children. *May irritate the skin or mucus membranes.
{{Wikipedia|Peppermint}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Roman Chamomile

revision.text: [[File:Rumian.JPG|right|150px|''Anthemis nobilis'' flower]] ;Roman Chamomile (''Anthemis nobilis'') Roman Chamomile oil comes from the flowers of ''Anthemis nobilis'' (also known as ''Chamaemelum nobile''). It has a sweet apple-like scent and an anti-inflammatory effect. ==Properties== ===Gynecological=== May relieve premenstrual syndrome. ===Respiratory=== Helps [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Asthma|asthma]] and hay fever. ===Skin=== Soothes sensitive or dry skin. May relieve [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]], rashes, dermatitis, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and minor wounds. ==Caution== *Don't use Roman chamomile oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Anthemis nobilis}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

== Customer involvement (alpha > 0.7; composite reliability = 0.85; average variance extracted = 0.55) == === Description ===
The research takes a step toward clarifying the concept of lean production and develops and validates a multi-dimensional measure of lean production. The 10 distinct dimensions of a lean system are [[Handbook of Management Scales/Continuous flow|continuous flow]], customer involvement, [[Handbook of Management Scales/Employee involvement|employee involvement]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/JIT delivery by suppliers|JIT delivery by suppliers]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/Pull|pull]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/Set up time reduction|set up time reduction]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/Statistical process control|statistical process control]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/Supplier development|supplier development]], [[Handbook of Management Scales/Supplier feedback|supplier feedback]], and [[Handbook of Management Scales/Total productive and preventive maintenance|total productive/preventive maintenance]].
=== Definition ===
Lean production is an integrated socio-technical system whose main objective is to eliminate waste by concurrently reducing or minimizing supplier, customer, and internal variability. This dimension of lean production is about focusing on a firm‚Äôs customers and their needs.
=== Items ===
Please indicate the extent of implementation of each of the following practices in your plant. (1) no implementation; (2) little implementation; (3) some implementation; (4) extensive implementation; (5) complete implementation.
*We frequently are in close contact with our customers. *Our customers give us feedback on quality and delivery performance. *Our customers are actively involved in current and future product offerings. *Our customers are directly involved in current and future product offerings. *Our customers frequently share current and future demand information with key marketing department.
=== Source ===
*[http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jom.2007.01.019 Shah/Ward (2007): DeÔ¨Åning and developing measures of lean production. Journal of Operations Management, Vol. 25, No. 4, pp. 785-805.]
== Customer involvement (alpha = 0.672) == === Items ===
*We are frequently in close contact with customers. *Our customers seldom visit our plant. (not used in Flynn/Flynn 1999) *Our customers give us feedback on quality and delivery performance. *Our customers are actively involved in the product design process. *We strive to be highly responsive to our customers' needs. *We regularly survey our customers' requirements.
=== Source ===
*Morita/Flynn (1997): The linkage among management systems, practices and behaviour in successful manufacturing strategy. International Journal of Operations & Production Management, Vol. 17, No. 10, pp. 967-993. *[http://doi.wiley.com/10.1111/j.1540-5915.1999.tb00917.x Flynn/Flynn (1999): Information-Processing Alternatives for Coping with Manufacturing Environment Complexity. Decision Sciences, Vol. 30, No. 4, pp. 1021-1052.]
{{BookCat}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Sandalwood

revision.text:
[[File:Santalum album (Chandan) in Hyderabad, AP W IMG 0023.jpg|right|150px|''Santalum album'' flowers]] ;Sandalwood (''Santalum album'') Sandalwood oil comes from the wood of ''Santalum album'' trees. It has a woody scent. Its effects are soothing and antiseptic. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Helps alleviate insomnia. ===Respiratory=== Relives sore throat, chesty cough and laryngitis. May soothe bronchitis and asthma.
{{Wikipedia|Santalum album}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Juniper Berry

revision.text:
[[File:Jun com cones.jpg|right|200px|Juniper berries]] ;Juniper Berry (''Juniperus communis'') Juniper Berry oil comes from the seed cone of ''Juniperus communis''. It has an antiseptic and diuretic effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== May lower blood pressure and reduce fluid retention. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence and diarrhea. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and anxiety. Relieves insomnia and fatigue. ===Gynecological=== As a diuretic, may alleviate menstrual pain and swollen breasts during menstruation. ===Skin=== Helps [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], dandruff, oily skin and hair and weeping [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]]. ==Caution== *Don't use Juniper berry oil during the first five months of pregnancy. *Don't use it if you have kidney disease because of its diuretic properties.
{{Wikipedia|Juniper Berry}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Cypress

revision.text: [[File:Cupressus sempervirens cone 01 by Line1.jpg|right|150px|''Cupressus sempervirens'' cone]] ;Cypress (''Cupressus sempervirens'') Cypress oil comes from the needles and cones of ''Cupressus sempervirens'' trees. It has a woody scent and an astringent effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Helps relieve fluid retention, cellulite, hemorrhoids and varicose vains. ==Caution== *Don't use Cypress oil if you suffer from [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). {{Wikipedia|Cupressus sempervirens}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rosemary

revision.text: [[File:Rosmarinus officinalis 'Tuscan Blue'1.jpg|right|150px|''Rosmarinus officinalis'' flowers and leaves]] ;Rosemary (''Rosmarinus officinalis'') Rosemary oil comes from the flowers of ''Rosmarinus officinalis'' plants. It has an antiseptic, stimulating and analgesic effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== May raise blood pressure and improve circulation. Reduces water retention and improves varicose veins. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence, constipation and diarrhea. May stimulate the liver ===Emotional=== Rosemary is a very useful oil for stimulating the mind. It improves concentration and memory and helps overcome mental fatigue and exhaustion. ===Gynecological=== May help to regulate an irregular menstrual cycle. ===Pain=== It can relieve headaches, migraine and neuralgia as well as rheumatism and arthritis. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], sinusitis and catarrh. ==Caution== *Don't use rosemary oil during the first five months of pregnancy. *Don't use rosemary oil if you suffer from [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). {{Wikipedia|Rosemary}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Clary Sage

revision.text: [[File:Salvia sclarea infloresc.jpg|right|150px|''Salvia sclarea'' flowers]] ;Clary Sage (''Salvia sclarea'') Clary Sage comes from the flowers of ''Salvia sclarea'' plants. It has a sweet scent. It has both a relaxing and an invigorating effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== May reduce [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). ===Emotional=== Relieves stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Uplifts the mind and alleviates fatigue. ==Caution== *Don't use clary sage oil during the first five months of pregnancy. *Clary sage oil can cause drowsiness so don't use with alcohol. {{Wikipedia|Salvia sclarea}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lemon

revision.text:
[[File:Lemon tree Berkeley closeup.jpg|right|150px|Lemons]] ;Lemon (''Citrus limon'') Lemon oil comes from the rind of lemons, the fruit of ''Citrus limon'' trees. It has a fresh citrus scent. It has an antiseptic effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces blood pressure, improves varicose veins. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion and constipation. ===Skin=== Helps [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], oily skin and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Athlete's foot|athlete's foot]]. ==Caution== *Don't expose the skin to sunlight after using lemon oil.
{{Wikipedia|Lemon}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Basil

revision.text: [[File:Starr 070906-8881 Ocimum basilicum var. thyrsiflorum.jpg|right|150px|Basil flowers and leaves]] ;Basil (''Ocimum basilicum'') Basil oil comes from the leaves and flowers of ''Ocimum basilicum'' plants. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Respiratory=== Relieves sinus congestion and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]]. ===Skin=== Helps [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and soothes insect bites. ==Caution== *Don't use basil oil during pregnancy. *It may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Basil}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bergamot

revision.text:
[[File:Bergamottepflanze.jpg|right|150px|Bergamot oranges]]
[[File:BergamotEssOil.png|right|150px|Bergamot essential oil]] ;Bergamot (''Citrus bergamia'') Bergamot oil comes from the rind of bergamot oranges, the fruit of ''Citrus aurantium'' (also known as ''Citrus bergamia'') trees. It has a sweet citrus scent. It has an antiseptic and uplifting effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Reduces flatulence and improves the appetite. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Skin=== Helps [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], oily skin, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]], psoriasis and minor wounds. ==Caution== *Don't use bergamot oil during pregnancy. *Don't expose the skin to sunlight after using bergamot oil. {{Wikipedia|Bergamot essential oil}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Mobility flexibility == === Items === For your manufacturing plant how important is the ability to (1 - no importance, 4 - very important, 7 - absolutely critical): *Make ra...'
revision.text:
== Mobility flexibility == === Items ===
For your manufacturing plant how important is the ability to (1 - no importance, 4 - very important, 7 - absolutely critical):
*Make rapid design changes. *Adjust capacity quickly. *Make rapid volume changes.
=== Source ===
*[http://doi.wiley.com/10.1111/j.1937-5956.2004.tb00224.x Anand/Ward (2004): Fit, Flexibility and Performance in Manufacturing: Coping with Dynamic Environments. Production and Operations Management, Vol. 13, No. 4, pp. 369‚Äì385.]
=== Related Scales ===
*[[Handbook of Management Scales/Range flexibility|Range flexibility]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Range flexibility == === Items === For your manufacturing plant how important is the ability to (1 - no importance, 4 - very important, 7 - absolutely critical): *Offer a la...'
revision.text:
== Range flexibility == === Items ===
For your manufacturing plant how important is the ability to (1 - no importance, 4 - very important, 7 - absolutely critical):
*Offer a large number of diverse product features. *Offer a large degree of product variety. *Adjust product mix.
=== Source ===
*[http://doi.wiley.com/10.1111/j.1937-5956.2004.tb00224.x Anand/Ward (2004): Fit, Flexibility and Performance in Manufacturing: Coping with Dynamic Environments. Production and Operations Management, Vol. 13, No. 4, pp. 369‚Äì385.]
=== Related Scales ===
*[[Handbook of Management Scales/Mobility flexibility|Mobility flexibility]]
{{BookCat}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Ylang Ylang

revision.text:
[[File:Cananga odorata.jpg|right|150px|''Cananga odorata'']] ;Ylang Ylang (''Cananga odorata'') Ylang ylang oil comes from the flowers of the ''Cananga odorata'' tree. It has a sweet, floral scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). ===Emotional=== Helps relieve stress and anxiety. Encourages deep sleep. ===Immunological=== Fights intestinal infections. ===Sexual=== Can help relieve sexual dysfunction. Can act as an aphrodisiac. ==Caution== *Ylang ylang oil may irritate sensitive skin. *The strong scent may cause headache or nausea.
{{Wikipedia|Cananga odorata}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Patchouli

revision.text:
[[File:Pogostemon cablin 001.jpg|right|200px|''Pogostemon cablin'' leaves and flowers]] ;Patchouli (''Pogostemon cablin'') Patchouli oil comes from the leaves of ''Pogostemon cablin'' plants. It has a spicy, woody scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces water retention and cellulite. ===Digestive=== Relieves constipation. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Gynecological=== Helps premenstrual syndrome. ===Immunological=== Fights bacterial and fungal infections. ===Sexual=== Increases libido. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]] and scar tissue. Promotes wound healing. Alleviates insect bites.
{{Wikipedia|Patchouli}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Petitgrain

revision.text:
[[File:Arancio Bizzarria.jpg|right|150px|''Citrus aurantium'' leaves]] ;Petitgrain (''Citrus aurantium'') Petitgrain oil comes from the leaves of bitter orange (''Citrus aurantium'') trees. It can be used as a cheaper alternative to [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Neroli|neroli]] oil, which is made from the blossoms of the same plant. Petitgrain has a sweet, floral, woody scent. It has a calming, relaxing effect on the mind and body. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and anxiety. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], oily skin and excessive perspiration. ==Caution== *Don't use petitgrain oil during pregnancy.
{{Wikipedia|Petitgrain}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bitter Orange
Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Neroli

revision.text: [[File:Citrus aurantium - K√∂hler‚Äìs Medizinal-Pflanzen-042.jpg|right|150px|''Citrus aurantium'' leaves, flowers and fruits]] ;Neroli (''Citrus aurantium'') Neroli essence oil comes from the flowers of the bitter orange (''Citrus aurantium'') trees. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Alleviates indigestion, flatulence and irritable bowl syndrome. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Reduces insomnia. May help with panic attacks. ===Skin=== Improves dry skin and scar tissue. May help prevent stretch marks. ==Caution== *Don't use neroli oil during pregnancy. *Has a sedative effect. {{Wikipedia|Neroli}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Ginger

revision.text: [[File:Starr 070730-7818 Zingiber officinale.jpg|right|150px|Ginger roots]] ;Ginger (''Zingiber officinale'') Ginger oil comes from the root of ''Zingiber officinale'' plants. It has a warm and spicy scent. It has warming, uplifting and stimulating effects. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Alleviates nausea, indigestion, flatulence, diarrhea and constipation. ===Emotional=== Soothes [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Respiratory=== Eases catarrh, bronchitis, colds and flu. ==Caution== *May cause photo-sensitivity. {{Wikipedia|Ginger}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/German Chamomile

revision.text: [[File:Kamille 02.jpg|right|150px|''Matricaria recutita'' flowers]] ;German Chamomile (''Matricaria recutita'') German chamomile oil comes from the flowers of ''Matricaria recutita''. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Stimulates the liver and gall bladder. ===Skin=== Soothes dry or irritated skin, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]] and psoriasis. ===Urological=== Helps urinary stones. ==Caution== *Don't use German chamomile oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Matricaria recutita}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Black Pepper

revision.comment: started page for black pepper oil
revision.text: [[File:BlackPeppercorns.JPG|right|150px|Black peppercorns]] ;Black Pepper (''Piper nigrum'') Black pepper oil comes from the fruit (peppercorns) of the ''Piper nigrum'' plant. It has a warm, spicy, peppery scent. It has a diuretic and stimulating effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, heartburn, flatulence and constipation. Improves appetite. Increases saliva. ===Immunological=== Fights colds and flu. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates sinus congestion. ==Caution== *Don't use black pepper oil during pregnancy. *It may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Black pepper}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Cajuput

revision.text: [[File:Melaleuca leucadendron flowers.jpg|right|200px|Leaves and flowers of the ''Melaleuca leucadendron'' tree]] ;Cajuput (''Melaleuca leucadendra'') Cajuput oil comes from the leaves of the ''Melaleuca leucadendra'' tree. It has a sweet scent. It has an antiseptic effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Soothes vomiting. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], laryngitis and symptoms of a cold. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and psoriasis. ==Caution== *Cajuput oil may irritate the skin and mucus membranes. {{Wikipedia|Cajuput oil}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Citronella

revision.text: ;Citronella (''Cymbopogon nardus'') Citronella oil comes from the leaves and stems of the ''Cymbopogon nardus'' grass. It has a sweet, citrus, grassy scent. It has an antiseptic effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Soothes stomach pain. ===Immunological=== Helps fight cold, flu and other infections. ===Skin=== Improves oily skin and excessive perspiration. ===Other uses=== Repels insects. Helps get rid of fleas in cats and dogs. ==Caution== *Citronella oil may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Citronella oil}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Virginian Cedarwood

revision.text: [[File:Starr 080117-2026 Juniperus virginiana.jpg|right|150px|Wood and leaves of ''Juniperus virginiana'' tree]] ;Virginian Cedarwood (''Juniperus virginiana'') Virginian cedarwood oil comes from the wood of the ''Juniperus virginiana'' tree. It has a woody scent. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes anxiety. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and soothes itchy skin. ==Caution== *Don't use Virginian cedarwood oil during pregnancy. *It may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Juniperus virginiana}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

revision.text: [[File:Jasminum officinale - Bot. Mag. 31, 1787.jpg|right|150px|Jasmine flowers]] ;Jasmine (''Jasminum officinale'') Jasmine oil comes from the flowers of the ''Jasminum officinale'' plant. It has a sweet scent. ==Properties== ===Childbirth=== Can hasten childbirth. Promotes lactation. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. May improve confidence. ===Respiratory=== Eases catarrh, coughs and laryngitis. ===Sexual=== May relieve sexual dysfunction. ==Caution== *Don't use jasmine oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Jasminum officinale}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

revision.text: [[File:Thymus vulgaris10.JPG|right|150px|Thyme flowers]] ;Thyme (''Thymus vulgaris'') Thyme oil comes from the flowers and leaves of the ''Thymus vulgaris'' plant. It has a sweet herbal scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Increases blood pressure. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Improves memory and concentration. ===Immunological=== Helps fight colds, flu and other infections. ===Respiratory=== Eases asthma, catarrh, coughs and laryngitis. ===Urological=== Relieves cystitis and urethritis. ==Caution== *Don't use thyme oil during pregnancy. *Don't use if you have [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). {{Wikipedia|Thymus vulgaris}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

revision.text: [[File:Majeranek2.jpg|right|150px|Marjoram leaves]] ;Marjoram (''Origanum majorana'') Marjoram oil comes from the flowers and leaves of the ''Origanum majorana'' plant. It has a spicy, herbal scent. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and anxiety. Reduces hyperactivity. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence and constipation. ===Immunological=== Helps fight colds. ===Respiratory=== Eases asthma, bronchitis and sinusitis. ==Caution== *Don't use marjoram oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Marjoram}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

{{Pizzonese-Message}}
{{Pizzonese}} {| class="wikitable" style="width:75%" |- | Aa | h√† | Bb | b√≠ | Cc | c√≠ | Dd | d√≠ |- | Ee | h√® | Ff | effe | Gg | g√≠ | Hh | hacca |- | Ii | h√¨ | Jj | h√¨ l√≥nga | Ll | helle | Mm | hemme |- | Nn | henne | Oo | h√≤ | Pp | p√≠ | Qq | c√π |- | Rr | herre | Ss | hesse | Tt | t√≠ | Uu | h√π |- | Vv | v√π | Zz | zetta | | | | |} ==Final vowels and vowel reduction== A good portion of Pizzonese words end in ''-e'', this unstressed '''e''' stands for the schwa sound that has become such a distinct part of Southern Italian languages. The schwa (the English '''uh''' sound) is the most frequent vowel in Pizzonese, let alone in the Neapolitan language continuum itself. In Pizzonese, any unstressed '''a, e, o, i,''' and '''u''' in writing can be weakened into short versions of themselves, and are even simplified down to a schwa in some situations. The '''a''' stays the strongest out of all the vowels though, and is only partially weakened most of the time, so that way you can still tell the original '''a''' sound. Examples of vowel reduction are in the words ''c'''u'''menz√†'' and ''camm'''i'''ni√©''. Similarly, Neapolitan has much the same guidelines as Pizzonese. (Or should I say otherwise!) ==Consonants== The consonants of Pizzonese are ''b, c, d, f, g, h, j, l, m, n, p, q, r, s, t, u, v,'' and ''z''. Depending on the consonant, they could be basic as in English, they could be palatalized, silent, or operate in conjunction with another letter. Here's an explanation of all vowels and vowel combinations. ====Regular consonants==== The regular consonants' are pronounced consistently and as in English and Italian with the only modification being doubling, being ''b, d, f, j, l, m, n, p, r, s,'' and ''t'' ====Digraphs==== There are as the above, except they are digraphs or accented, and thus not counted as letters on their own: *'''c:''' pronounced as in English and Italian before '''a, o,''' and '''u''', but before '''e''' and '''i''', they are...

{| class="infobox" style="width: 18%; text-align: center; {{#ifeq:{{{size|}}}|large||font-size: 88%;}} line-height: auto" |- ! style="font-size: 250%" | [[Pizzonese]] |- ! style="font-size: 90%" | a Western Abruzzese dialect of the

{{ingredient}} [[Image:Chinesemustardgreens.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Cantonese-style braised mustard greens, with wolfberries]] '''''Brassica juncea''''', also known as '''mustard greens''', '''Indian mustard''' and '''leaf mustard''', is a species of mustard plant. Sub-varieties include Southern Giant Curled Mustard, which resembles a headless cabbage such as [[Cookbook:Kale|Kale]], but with a distinct horseradish-mustard flavor. It is also known as ''green mustard cabbage''.
==Uses==
The leaves, the seeds, and the stem of this mustard variety are edible. The plant appears in some form in African, Indian, Chinese, Japanese, and Soul food cuisine. Cultivars of ''B. juncea'' are grown as greens, and for the production of oilseed. The leaves are used in African cooking, and leaves, seeds, and stems are used in Indian cuisine, particular in Punjab cuisine of India and Pakistan, where a famous dish called 'Saarson da saag'(lit. mustard greens) is prepared. ''B. juncea'' subsp. ''tatsai'' which has a particularly thick stem, is used to make the Indian pickle called Achar, and the Chinese pickle ''zha cai''. The mustard made from the seeds of the Brassica juncea is called brown mustard. The leaves (Raai / Rai in Gujarati) are used in many Indian dishes.
Brassica juncea is more pungent than the closely-related ''Brassica oleracea'' greens (kale, cabbage, collard greens) and is frequently mixed with these milder greens in a dish of "mixed greens", which may include wild greens such as dandelion. As with other greens in soul food cooking, mustard greens are generally flavored by being cooked for a long period with ham hocks or other smoked pork products. Mustard greens are high in Vitamin A and Vitamin K.

{{Pizzonese-Message}}
{{Pizzonese}} As with other Romance languages, adjective endings in Pizzonese change depending upon the gender and quantity of the item they are modifying. {| class="wikitable" |style="width:100px", bgcolor="#e9e3c5"|'''Gender''' |style="width:100px", bgcolor="#e9e3c5"|'''Singular''' |style="width:100px", bgcolor="#e9e3c5"|'''Plural''' |- |align="left"|masculine |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8a9"|'''gle''' |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|'''le''' |- |align="left"|feminine |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8a9"|'''la''' |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|'''le''' |} For the most part, adjectives follow the object they describe, for example ''la casa ghi√©nca'' (the white house), literally it reads "the house white". ==Possessive adjectives== {| class="wikitable" |bgcolor=#e9e3c5 align="left" style="width:60px"|'''English''' |bgcolor=#e9e3c5 align="left" style="width:60px"|'''Masc.''' |bgcolor=#e9e3c5 align="left" style="width:60px"|'''Fem.''' |- |align="left"|mine |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|gle m√™ |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la m√™ |- |align="left"|yours |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|gle t√™ |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la t√™ |- |align="left"|his/hers |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|gle s√™ |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la s√™ |- |align="left" |ours |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|gle nuostre |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la nostra |- |align="left"|yours |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|gle vuostre |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la vostra |- |align="left"|theirs |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|le s√™ |align="left" bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|la s√™ |} In Pizzonese, as with other Southern Italian languages, there can be a fusion of the possessive adjective with the noun it refers to. This mainly applies to possessive kinship terms; '''pateme''' for ''my father''; '''frateme''' for ''my brother''; '''sorema''' for ''my sister''; '''soreta''' for ''your sister''. This applies only to words that indicate familiar relationships and is a vestige from Ancient Greek, and is somewhat related to the French counterpart.

'''English''' |- |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|me |align="left"|myself |- |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|te |align="left"|yourself |- |align="left", bgcolor="#c9c8e9"|ze |align="left"|themselves |}

'''Theorem''' ‚Äì weak L'H√¥pital's rule ‚Äì Let <math>I</math> ⊆ '''R''', ''u'' ∈ <math>I</math>, and ''f'', ''g'': <math>I</math> \ {''u''} ‚Üí '''R''' be differentiable functions such that ∃lim<sub>u</sub> g' ∈ '''R''', and lim<sub>u</sub> g' ≠ 0. If #<math>\exists\lim\limits_{u} f=0,\quad\exists\lim\limits_{u} g=0</math> and #<math>\exists\lim\limits_{u}\frac{f'}{g'}\in \mathbf{R}</math> then lim<sub>u</sub>(f/g) also exists, and :<math>\lim\limits_{u}\frac{f}{g}=\lim\limits_{u}\frac{f'}{g'}</math>
''Proof.'' 1) ''u'' is an accumulation point of he domain of ''g''. Since, lim<sub>u</sub> g' ≠ 0.
2) Both ''f'' and ''g'' extend to an <math>I</math> ‚Üí '''R''' differentiable function, by setting ''f''(''u'')=0 and ''g''(''u'')=0. Indeed, by Lagrange Theorem, for every ''x'' ∈ <math>I</math> there is an x'∈ <math>I</math> between ''x'' and ''u'' such that :<math>\frac{g(x)-g(u)}{x-u}=g'(x')</math> Hence, :<math>g'(u)=\lim\limits_{x\to u}\frac{g(x)-g(u)}{x-u}=\lim\limits_{x'\to u}g'(x')=\lim\limits_{u}g'\in \mathbf{R}</math>

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Clove

revision.comment: Replacing Koeh-030.jpg with [[File:Syzygium_aromaticum_-_K√∂hler‚Äìs_Medizinal-Pflanzen-030.jpg]] (by [[commons:User:Billinghurst|Billinghurst]] because: [[commons:Commons:File renaming|File renamed]]: Renaming per [[commons::commons:FM|file renam...
revision.text: [[File:Syzygium_aromaticum_-_K√∂hler‚Äìs_Medizinal-Pflanzen-030.jpg|right|150px|Cloves]] ;Clove (''Syzygium aromaticum'') Clove oil comes from the flower buds and leaves of the ''Syzygium aromaticum'' (also known as ''Eugenia caryophyllata'') tree. It has a strong spicy scent. It has an analgesic and stimulating effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, vomiting, flatulence and diarrhea. ===Pain=== Eases toothache, sore muscles, rheumatism and arthritis. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Asthma|asthma]], bronchitis and symptoms of a cold. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and helps healing of minor wounds and burns. ==Other uses== Repels insects. Can be used as a room disinfectant. ===Caution=== *Don't use clove oil during pregnancy. *Clove oil may irritate the skin. It should only be used diluted to less than 1%. {{Wikipedia|Clove}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

Some oils present specific dangers to people who are pregnant, or have medical conditions. In addition to the precautions below, if you are pregnant or have an existing medical condition, always check with your doctor before using essential oils or trying aromatherapy. ==Pregnancy== The following oils should not be used by pregnant women. *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Basil|Basil]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bay Laurel|Bay Laurel]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bergamot|Bergamot]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Black Pepper|Black Pepper]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Carrot Seed|Carrot Seed]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Cinnamon|Cinnamon]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Atlas Cedarwood|Cedarwood, Atlas]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Virginian Cedarwood|Cedarwood, Virginian]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/German Chamomile|Chamomile, German]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Roman Chamomile|Chamomile, Roman]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Clary Sage|Clary Sage]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Clove|Clove]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Dill|Dill]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Hyssop|Hyssop]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Jasmine|Jasmine]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Juniper Berry|Juniper Berry]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Marjoram|Marjoram]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Myrrh|Myrrh]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Neroli|Neroli]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Nutmeg|Nutmeg]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Oakmoss|Oakmoss]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Oregano|Oregano]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Parsley|Parsley]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Peppermint|Peppermint]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Petitgrain|Petitgrain]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rose Geranium|Rose Geranium]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rosemary|Rosemary]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Tagetes|Tagetes]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Thyme|Thyme]] *[[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Fennel

revision.text: [[File:Foeniculum vulgare G.jpg|right|150px|Fennel seeds]] ;Fennel (''Foeniculum vulgare'') Fennel oil comes from the seeds of the ''Foeniculum vulgare'' plant. It has an earthy, herby, spicy scent. It has an diuretic and stimulating effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, nausea, vomiting, flatulence and constipation. May cure hiccups. ===Skin=== Improves oily skin and the appearance of aging. ===Caution=== *Don't use fennel oil during pregnancy. *Don't use fennel oil if you have epilepsy. *Fennel oil can have a narcotic effect. {{Wikipedia|Fennel}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Frankincense

revision.text: [[File:Frankincense 2005-12-31.jpg|right|150px|Frankincense]] ;Frankincense (''Boswellia sacra'') Frankincense (or olibanum) oil comes from the resin (dried sap) of the ''Boswellia sacra'' (also known as ''Boswellia carterii'') tree. It has an sweet, woody, spicy scent. It has an antiseptic and uplifting effect. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes anxiety and calms the mind. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Asthma|asthma]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], laryngitis, coughs and the symptoms of a cold. ===Skin=== Improves the appearance of aging. Helps the healing of minor wounds and scars. {{Wikipedia|Frankincense}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

*'''-√®''' (formerly ''-√®re'') is used when the ultimate (formerly penultimate) syllable is stressed‚Äìas in ''ved'''√®''''' (formerly ''ved'''√®'''re'') *'''-ere''' is used when the antepenultimate syllable is stressed‚Äìas in ''d'''√≠'''cere'' Also note that '''()''' denotes stem changes, which will be explained soon. ===Present tense=== {| class="wikitable" | |bgcolor=#e5e5e5 align="left" The simple remote form as used below though is barely used, as ''Pizzonesi'' usually speak of the future in terms of what they ''have to'' do, as originally there were no future tenses (as in ''I will {{inactive}}
''' WikiProject Vestibule to The Book '''
[[File:Open book 01.svg|left|50px]]
{{Edit|Wikibooks:WikiProject Vestibule to The Book}} "The Book" is a concept introduced by [[Wikipedia:Paul Erd≈ës|Paul Erd≈ës]]. The Book contains the shortest, most elegant, most illuminating, and most memorable proof of every existing or future mathematical theorem. These are "The Book proofs." The highest compliment Erd≈ës could pay to a colleague‚Äôs work was to say, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs straight from The Book.‚Äù '''WikiProject Vestibule to The Book''' is a group of wikibookians who collaborate on the wikibook [[Vestibule to The Book]] in which the potential proofs from Erd≈ës's imaginary book are collected. The project aims to help coordinate and organize the writing and editing of this wikibook. We will open a separate web page which will contain the selected (by election, voting) proofs. So this wikibook is the collaborative vestibule to the final fixed book: Proofs from The Book. 0. The final repository is named : Proofs from The Book 1. The project name The Vestibule project 2. The wikibook name Vestibule to The Book 3. Roles of proof selection 1. Minimal conditions: i. Correctness of the proof ii. Correct form and style iii. wiki-compatibility iv. MSC is given v. Level is given (K4, undergrad, graduate, advanced or others‚Ä¶?) 2. Nomination at least by two proposers (independent from the author and entry editor) a. Independence means not from the same institute b. Independence means no coauthorship c. Independence means no math genealogical direct link (mentor, supervisor, stundent‚Ä¶?) d. Independence is declaired by the proposer and normally not verified. In case of suspicious proposal administrators and or editors vote. 3. After the nomination for a longer period (say X years, I propose 5) votes are collected, visits are counted on proof pages. Each year the top Y (I propose 5%) percentage of the proofs reaching the age of Y year in the repository the proofs are labeled as candidates. 4. Candidates which has not essentially modified and no objection aroused after another Z years, ( I propose 5) get another short intensive poll period. Votes are collected, visits are counted on proof pages and the proof is moved to the permanent Book if gets P (say 90%) percentage positive votes [[User:Telcs|Telcs]] ([[User talk:Telcs|talk]]) 19:00, 30 March 2010 (UTC) As a new initiative, definitions and counterexamples of the same exceptional spirit will be included into the project. [[User:Telcs|Telcs]] ([[User talk:Telcs|talk]]) 19:00, 30 March 2010 (UTC)

'''Standards'''
'''Guidelines for Mathematics texts''' * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:WikiProject Mathematics/Conventions]] (a working list of terminology conventions) * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:Naming conventions (theorems)]] * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:Manual of Style (mathematics)]] * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:Algorithms on Wikipedia]] * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:Scientific citation guidelines]] These standards, as with all [[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines|Wikipedia guidelines]], are not obligatory. However, it should be noted that any article that is seeking [[Wikipedia:What is a featured article?|featured article]] status should comply with these standards. Note that new standards should be subjected to consensus building before being added here (a consensus should be reached on the discussion page). {{Edit|Wikibooks:WikiProject Vestibule to The Book}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Grapefruit

revision.comment: Replacing Citrus_paradisi_(Grapefruit,_pink).jpg with [[File:Citrus_paradisi_(Grapefruit,_pink)_white_bg.jpg]] (by [[commons:User:Adam Cuerden|Adam Cuerden]] because: Colour fix).
revision.text: [[File:Citrus_paradisi_(Grapefruit,_pink)_white_bg.jpg|right|150px|Sliced grapefruits]] ;Grapefruit (''Citrus √ó paradisi'') Grapefruit oil comes from the rind of the fruit of the ''Citrus √ó paradisi'' (also known as ''Citrus racemosa'') tree. It has a sweet citrus scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces water retention and cellulite. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and oily skin. ==Caution== Don't expose the skin to sunlight after using grapefruit oil. {{Wikipedia|Grapefruit}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Hyssop

revision.text: [[File:Hyssopus officinalis.jpg|right|150px|Hyssop flowers]] ;Hyssop (''Hyssopus officinalis'') Hyssop oil comes from the leaves and flowers of the ''Hyssopus officinalis'' plant. It has a warm, sweet scent and is a middle note scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces water retention. Raises blood pressure. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion and flatulence. ===Emotional=== Soothes anxiety and fatigue. ===Gynecological=== Helps to regulate the menstrual cycle. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], coughs and symptoms of a cold. ==Caution== *Don't use hyssop oil during pregnancy. *Don't use hyssop oil if you have epilepsy. *Don't use hyssop oil if you have [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). {{Wikipedia|Hyssop}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lemongrass

revision.text: [[File:Starr 071024-9896 Cymbopogon citratus.jpg|right|150px|Lemongrass leaves]] ;Lemongrass (''Cymbopogon citratus'') Lemongrass oil comes from the leaves of the ''Cymbopogon citratus'' plant. It has a sweet citrus scent. It has an antidepressant and diuretic effect. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion and stimulates the appetite. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, nervousness and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates laryngitis. ===Skin=== Improves oily skin and fights athlete's foot. Reduces excessive perspiration. ===Other uses=== Repels insects. ==Caution== *Lemongrass oil may irritate sensitive skin. May provoke Asthma attack in Ashmatic patients. {{Wikipedia|Cymbopogon citratus}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Myrrh

revision.text: [[File:Myrrh.JPG|right|200px|Myrrh]] ;Myrrh (''Commiphora myrrha'') Myrrh oil comes from the resin (dried sap) of the ''Commiphora myrrha'' tree. It has a warm, spicy scent. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence, diarrhea and hemorrhoids. ===Gynecological=== Relieves menstrual pain. ===Immunological=== Stimulates the immune system. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates bronchitis, catarrh, coughs and symptoms of a cold. ===Skin=== Alleviates [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]], skin ulcers and athlete's foot. ==Caution== *Don't use myrrh oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Myrrh}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Pine

revision.text: [[File:Fragment drzewa.JPG|right|200px|Scots pine needles and buds]] ;Pine (''Pinus sylvestris'') Pine oil comes from the twigs and buds of the ''Pinus sylvestris'' (Scots Pine) tree. It has a fresh, woody scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Stimulates circulation. ===Emotional=== Invigorates and reduces mental fatigue. ===Pain=== Relieves muscle pain and rheumatism. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates bronchitis, laryngitis, sinusitis and symptoms of colds and flu. ===Skin=== Helps healing of minor wounds and sores. ===Urological=== Relieves cystitis. ==Caution== *Pine oil may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Scots Pine}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rose

revision.text: [[File:Rosa damascena6.jpg|right|200px|Damask rose flowers]] ;Rose (''Rosa √ó damascena'') Rose oil comes from the flowers of the ''Rosa √ó damascena'' (Damask Rose) plant. It has a deep floral scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Stimulates circulation. ===Digestive=== Relieves nausea. ===Emotional=== Soothes anger, stress, nervousness and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. Helps insomnia. ===Gynecological=== Balances hormones and regulates the menstrual cycle. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, hay fever, coughs and sore throat. ===Skin=== Improves the appearance of aging and broken capillaries. Improves dry skin, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]] and the effect of herpes. ==Caution== *Don't use rose oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Rosa damascena}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Vetiver

revision.text: [[File:Vetiveria zizanioides0.jpg|right|200px|Vetiver leaves]] ;Vetiver (''Chrysopogon zizanioides'') Vetiver oil comes from the roots of the ''Chrysopogon zizanioides'' (''Vetiveria zizanioides'') plant. It has a woody, earthy scent. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, nervousness, exhaustion and insomnia. ===Pain=== Relieves arthritis, rheumatism and muscle pain. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and the appearance of aging. {{Wikipedia|Chrysopogon zizanioides}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Tangerine

revision.text: [[File:TangerineFruit.jpg|right|200px|A tangerine]] ;Tangerine (''Citrus √ó tangerina'') Tangerine oil comes from the rind of the fruit of the ''Citrus √ó tangerina'' (a variety of ''Citrus reticulata'') tree. It has a fruity citrus scent. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Stimulates circulation and reduces water retention. ===Digestive=== Relieves flatulence, diarrhea and constipation. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress. ===Skin=== Reduces stretch marks. ==Caution== Don't expose the skin to sunlight after using tangerine oil. {{Wikipedia|Tangerine}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Angelica

revision.text: [[File:Angelica archangelica 002.JPG|right|200px|Angelica]] ;Angelica (''Angelica archangelica'') Angelica oil comes from the roots of the ''Angelica archangelica'' (''Archangelica officinalis'') plant. It has a herby, spicy scent and is a base note oil. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces water retention. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion and flatulence. ===Pain=== Soothes rheumatism and arthritis. ===Skin=== Improves psoriasis. ==Caution== *Don't use angelica oil if you are diabetic. {{Wikipedia|Garden Angelica}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Tea Tree

revision.text: [[File:MelaleucaAlternifoliaEssOil.png|right|150px|A bottle of tea tree oil]] ;Tea Tree (''Melaleuca alternifolia'') Tea Tree oil comes from the roots of the ''Melaleuca alternifolia'' tree. It has a fresh, medicinal scent. It has anti-bacterial, anti-viral and anti-fungal effects. ==Properties== ===Immunological=== Helps fight colds, flu and fungal infections. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, bronchitis, sinusitis and coughs. ===Urological=== Alleviates cystitis, vaginal thrush and urinary tract infections. ==Caution== *Tea tree oil may irritate the skin. {{Wikipedia|Tea tree oil}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Eucalyptus

revision.text: [[File:Starr 050125-3235 Eucalyptus globulus.jpg|right|200px|Eucalyptus leaves]] ;Eucalyptus (''Eucalyptus globulus'') Eucalyptus oil comes from the leaves and twigs of the ''Eucalyptus globulus'' tree. It has a woody scent. ==Properties== ===Immunological=== Helps fight colds, flu other viral infections. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Asthma|asthma]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], catarrh, sinusitis and coughs. ===Skin=== Relieves herpes, burns and minor wounds. Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Athlete's foot|athlete's foot]]. ===Urological=== Alleviates urinary tract infections. ==Caution== *Don't ingest eucalyptus oil. *Don't use eucalyptus oil if you have epilepsy. *Don't use eucalyptus oil if you have [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Hypertension|hypertension]] (high blood pressure). {{Wikipedia|Eucalyptus globulus}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

Use the ''move'' tab (only becomes available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. {{BookCat}}

===Why Blender?===
Blender is an incredible free software program, and puts animating and 3d modeling capabilities within the reach of those that would otherwise not be able to afford expensive game making software like Maya, or 3DS Max. Moreover, as proven with the release of '[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yo_Frankie! Yo Frankie]!' Blender is a formidable game making program in its own right.
Unfortunately, very few of the available books, tutorials, etc. on Blender seem to be specific to the program's game making abilities. The purpose of this book is not to compete with existing blender wikibooks such as ''[[Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro|Blender 3D: Noob To Pro]]'' despite the similarity of any content. The reason I am starting this book is to fill in the blanks left by other resources pertinent specifically to the making of games. In my life, I am a game making student and I am very much learning the ropes of the industry. I make no pretense about being an expert on Blender or game making in general, however it is my hope that other wikibook contributors will be instrumental in helping to expand this book and that my own knowledge will improve in the process.
I will add to this book as and when I have time. In the following sections I've listed the topics which I feel should be covered. If you have knowledge regarding any of these, contributions are always welcomed. If I feel something can be improved I may alter it, or I may delete anything i think is out of place or irrelevant however.
Writing code is my weakness so contributions to Python scripting are especially welcomed!
===Sections===
==3D Modelling techniques for games== *[[/How to create a character/]] *[[/How to create an environment/]]
==Animation== *[[/How to create cut scenes/]] *[[/How to animate character behaviours/]]
==Python Scripting & Logic== *[[/General Logic/]] *[[/Python scripting for the FPS genre/]] *[[/Python scripting for the RTS genre/]] *[[/Python scripting for 2d games/]] *[[/Python scripting for third person shooters and sandbox games/]]
{{Subjects|Blender 3D}} {{alphabetical|B}} {{status|0%}} __NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__

The E.S shell simplifies the process of creating a knowledge base. It is the shell that actually processes the information entered by a user relates it to the concepts contained in the knowledge base and provides an assessment or solution for a particular problem. Thus E.S shell provides a layer between the user interface and the computer O.S to manage the input and output of the data. It also manipulates the information provided by the user in conjunction with the knowledge base to arrive at a particular conclusion.
{{BookCat}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Dill

revision.text: [[File:Anethum graveolens20090812 475.jpg|right|200px|''Anethum graveolens'']] ;Dill (''Anethum graveolens'') Dill oil comes from the seeds of the ''Anethum graveolens'' plant. It has a grassy scent. It has soothing and sedative effects. ==Properties== ===Digestive=== Alleviates indigestion, flatulence and constipation. May cure hiccups. ===Emotional=== Soothes nervousness and feelings of being overwhelmed. ===Skin=== Helps minor wounds to heal. ==Caution== *Don't use dill oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Dill}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Benzoin

revision.comment: Replacing Koeh-133.jpg with [[File:Styrax_benzoin_-_K√∂hler‚Äìs_Medizinal-Pflanzen-133.jpg]] (by [[commons:User:Billinghurst|Billinghurst]] because: [[commons:Commons:File renaming|File renamed]]: Renaming per [[commons:Commons:FR|file rename]] cr...
revision.text: [[File:Styrax_benzoin_-_K√∂hler‚Äìs_Medizinal-Pflanzen-133.jpg|right|200px|''Styrax benzoin'']] ;Benzoin (''Styrax benzoin'') Benzoin oil comes from the resin (dried sap) of the ''Styrax benzoin'' tree. It has a warm, sweet scent, similar to vanilla. It has a calming and stabilizing effect. It is a base note oil. ==Properties== [[File:Benzoe-Harz.jpg|right|150px|Benzoin resin]] ===Digestive=== Stimulates the pancreas and may help to stabilize blood sugar levels. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and nervousness. With a comforting and relaxing effect on the mind, it can help reduce "overthinking" and mental exhaustion. Use it with a carrier oil for massage or through inhalation. ===Immunological=== Benzoin has an anti-infectious property and can help to fight infection. ===Respiratory=== Relieves asthma, [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]], catarrh, coughs, laryngitis and symptoms of a cold. For coughs and sore throats, apply benzoin in a balm or cream to the throat and chest. ===Pain=== Eases muscle pain. Use with a carrier oil for massage, or add to a bath. Soothes mouth ulcers. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]], psoriasis, rashes and scar tissue. Helps chapped skin, chilblains, frostbite and minor wounds to heal. ==Blend with== Benzoin works well in blends with [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bergamot|bergamot]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Frankincense|frankincense]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Juniper Berry|juniper berry]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lavender|lavender]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lemon|lemon]], [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Bitter Orange|bitter orange]] and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Sandalwood|sandalwood]]. ==Caution== *Benzoin oil can be very relaxing. {{Wikipedia|Benzoin resin}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Carrot Seed

revision.text: [[File:Daucus carota May 2008-1 edit.jpg|right|150px|Carrot flowers]] ;Carrot Seed (''Daucus carota'') Carrot seed oil comes from the seeds of the ''Daucus carota'' plant. It has a sweet scent. It has calming and antiseptic effects. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces water retention and detoxifies the body. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and nervousness. ===Respiratory=== Relieves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Bronchitis|bronchitis]] and symptoms of flu. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Eczema|eczema]] and rashes. ==Caution== *Don't use carrot seed oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Daucus carota}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Cinnamon

revision.text: [[File:Cinnamomum verum 002.JPG|right|150px|Cinnamon leaves]] ;Cinnamon (''Cinnamomum verum'') Cinnamon oil comes from the leaves and bark of the ''Cinnamomum verum'' (''Cinnamomum zeylanicum'') plant. It has a warm, spicy scent. It has calming and antiseptic effects. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]] and exhaustion. ===Gynecological=== Reduces menstrual pain. ===Pain=== Relieves arthritis and rheumatism. ===Respiratory=== Relieves bronchitis and symptoms of flu. ==Caution== *Don't use cinnamon oil during pregnancy. *Cinnamon may irritate the skin. {{Wikipedia|Cinnamon}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Coriander

revision.text: [[File:Starr 080731-9595 Coriandrum sativum.jpg|right|150px|Coriander flowers]] ;Coriander (''Coriandrum sativum'') Coriander oil comes from the seeds of the ''Coriandrum sativum'' plant. It has a warm, spicy scent. It has both calming and stimulating effects. ==Properties== [[File:Koriandersamen.jpg|right|150px|Coriander seeds]] ===Circulatory=== Detoxifies the whole body. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence, wind and stomach cramps. ===Emotional=== Soothes nervousness and exhaustion. Uplifts and refreshes the mind. ===Pain=== Relieves arthritis, rheumatism and migraine. ===Respiratory=== Relieves symptoms of cold and flu. {{Wikipedia|Coriander}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Helichrysum

revision.text: [[File:Helichrysum italicum subsp microphyllum g08.jpg|right|150px|''Helichrysum italicum'' flowers]] ;Helichrysum (''Helichrysum italicum'') Helichrysum (or immortelle) oil comes from the flowers of the ''Helichrysum italicum'' (''Helichrysum angustifolium'') plant. It has a fruity scent. It has anti-inflammatory and diuretic effects. ==Properties== ===Pain=== Relieves arthritis and rheumatism. ===Respiratory=== Relieves asthma, bronchitis and symptoms of cold and flu. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], dermatitis and scars. ==Caution== *Don't use Helichrysum oil on children. {{Wikipedia|Helichrysum italicum}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lavandin

revision.text: [[File:Starr 080117-2168 Lavandula x intermedia.jpg|right|150px|''Lavandula x intermedia'' leaves]] ;Lavandin (''Lavandula x intermedia'') Lavandin (or lavendin) oil comes from the flowers of the ''Lavandula x intermedia'' (Dutch lavender) plant. ''Lavandula x intermedia'' is a hybrid of ''Lavandula angustifolia'' which produces [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lavender|lavender oil]], and lavandin is sometimes considered a cheaper or inferior version of lavender. It has a floral scent, similar to lavender. It has antidepressant and analgesic effects. ==Properties== Lavandin oil has similar properties to lavender oil. ===Pain=== Relieves muscle stiffness and pain. ===Respiratory=== Relieves coughs and symptoms of cold and flu. {{Wikipedia|Lavender}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Yarrow

revision.text: [[File:RNK002 Bube i biljka.jpg|right|150px|Yarrow flowers]] ;Yarrow (''Achillea millefolium'') Yarrow oil comes from the ''Achillea millefolium'' plant. It has a sweet, spicy scent. It has antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Reduces high blood pressure. Improves hemorrhoids and varicose veins. ===Digestive=== Relieves indigestion, flatulence and constipation. ===Gynecological=== Regulates the menstrual cycle. ===Skin=== Improves eczema, rashes and promotes healing of minor wounds and burns. ===Urological=== Relieves cystitis. ==Caution== *Don't use yarrow oil during pregnancy. *Yarrow oil may irritate sensitive skin. {{Wikipedia|Achillea millefolium}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Vanilla

revision.text: [[File:Vanilla1web.jpg|right|150px|Vanilla flower]] ;Vanilla (''Vanilla planifolia'') Vanilla oil comes from the fruit ("beans") of the ''Vanilla planifolia'' plant. It has a sweet scent. ==Properties== Vanilla oil is often used in perfumery, but not often used in aromatherapy. {{Wikipedia|Vanilla planifolia}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

==Merge with Java Programming/Variables?==
Shouldn't this page be merged with the [[Java Programming/Variables]] page? --[[User:ZeroOne|ZeroOne]] ([[User talk:ZeroOne|talk]]) 12:37, 22 March 2010 (UTC)
:Right, now that the merge has been done, this question looks pretty stupid. ;) [[User:ZeroOne|ZeroOne]] ([[User talk:ZeroOne|discuss]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/ZeroOne|contribs]]) 21:12, 15 May 2012 (UTC)
== Needs Exercises ==
I think the reader could have the option to write a little program that allows them to understand variables better.
I will have a crack at it sometime soon --[[User:Mattylaws|Mattylaws]] ([[User talk:Mattylaws|discuss]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Mattylaws|contribs]]) 09:20, 10 August 2012 (UTC)
== Dumbing down ==
This is too much for beginners, imagine you're starting a language for the first time and you have no idea what objects are, or types etc, we need just a small chapter with a couple of examples of using strings, integers and floats. --[[Special:Contributions/92.7.225.224|92.7.225.224]] ([[User talk:92.7.225.224|discuss]]) 12:05, 19 August 2012 (UTC)
== Test your knowledge ==
The "Test your knowledge" exercises are great! I think every page in this book should have a few of these. [[User:Brzlnboi|Brzlnboi]] ([[User talk:Brzlnboi|discuss]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Brzlnboi|contribs]]) 13:42, 19 August 2014 (UTC)

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Tuberose

revision.text: [[File:Polianthes tuberosa clean.jpg|right|150px|Tuberose flowers]] ;Tuberose (''Polianthes tuberosa'') Tuberose oil comes from the flowers of the ''Polianthes tuberosa'' plant. It has a sweet spicy scent. ==Properties== Tuberose oil is used in perfumery, but not often used in aromatherapy. ==Caution== *Tuberose oil can have a narcotic effect. {{Wikipedia|Polianthes tuberosa}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Tagetes

revision.text: [[File:Tagetes minuta flower.jpg|right|200px|Tagetes flowers]] ;Tagetes (''Tagetes minuta'') Tagetes oil comes from the flowers and leaves of the ''Tagetes minuta'' (Mexican marigold) plant. It has antiseptic and anti-infectious effects. ==Properties== ===Immunological=== Helps fight parasitic and fungal infections. ===Respiratory=== Eases catarrh and coughs. ===Skin=== Helps skin infections and promotes wound healing. Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Athlete's foot|athlete's foot]]. ===Other uses=== Repels insects. ==Caution== *Don't use tagetes oil during pregnancy. *Don't expose skin to sunlight after using tagetes oil. *Tagetes oil may irritate sensitive skin {{Wikipedia|Tagetes minuta}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Spearmint

revision.text: [[File:Mentha Spicata.jpg|right|150px|Spearmint flowers]] ;Spearmint (''Mentha spicata'') Spearmint oil comes from the flowering tops of the ''Mentha spicata'' plant. It has a stimulating effect. ==Properties== Spearmint oil has many of the same properties as [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Peppermint|peppermint oil]], but is gentler. ===Digestive=== Alleviates indigestion, nausea, vomiting and flatulence. May cure hiccups. ===Emotional=== Stimulates the mind. ===Gynecological=== Reduces heavy menstrual flow. ===Immunological=== Helps fight colds, flu and other infections. ===Respiratory=== Eases asthma, bronchitis, catarrh and coughs. ===Skin=== Relieves itching. {{Wikipedia|Mentha spicata}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

I run [http://edutechwiki.unige.ch/en/ EduTechWiki] but I plan to contribute here now and then :)
[http://edutechwiki.unige.ch/en/User:Daniel_K._Schneider My EduTech Wiki home page]
Pfff, uploading a picture here is like a major trip. In order to remember, I write it down here:
* go to commons-wikimedia * create an account and click on upload * fill in license information (ok I can understand that, but it should be simpler, i.e. fill in more defaults)
Example: http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Openscad-debug-modifier.png is used in [[OpenSCAD User Manual/Modifier Characters]]

</source>

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Lime

revision.text: [[File:Starr 061105-1380 Citrus aurantiifolia.jpg|right|150px|Lime tree]] ;Lime (''Citrus aurantifolia'') Lime oil comes from the rind of the fruits of ''Citrus aurantifolia'' or ''Citrus medica'' trees. It has a fruity citrus scent. It has an antiseptic effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Improves circulation. ===Emotional=== Soothes anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Pain=== Relieves arthritis, rheumatism, muscle and joint pain. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, bronchitis, sinusitis and coughs. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and herpes. ==Caution== *Don't expose the skin to sunlight after using lime oil. *Lime oil may irritate the skin. {{Wikipedia|Key lime}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Niaouli

revision.text: [[File:Melaleuca quinquenervia 2.jpg|right|175px|''Melaleuca quinquenervia'']] ;Niaouli (''Melaleuca quinquenervia'') Niaouli oil comes from the leaves and twigs of the ''Melaleuca quinquenervia'' tree. It has a fresh, sweet scent. It has an analgesic effect. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Uplifting, and improves concentration. ===Immunological=== Helps fight infections including colds and flu. ===Pain=== Relieves rheumatism and neuralgia. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, bronchitis, catarrh, laryngitis, sinusitis and coughs. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]] and promotes healing of burns and cuts. ===Urological=== Relieves cystitis and urinary infections. {{Wikipedia|Melaleuca quinquenervia}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Nutmeg

revision.text: [[File:Muskatnussbaum.jpg|right|150px|Nutmeg tree]] ;Nutmeg (''Myristica fragrans'') Nutmeg oil comes from the seeds of the ''Myristica fragrans'' tree. It has a spicy scent. It has a stimulating effect. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Stimulates the circulation. ===Digestive=== Alleviates flatulence, nausea, constipation and diarrhea. Improves the appetite. ===Emotional=== Stimulates the mind. ===Gynecological=== Regulates the menstrual cycle. ===Pain=== Relieves muscle pain and rheumatism. ===Respiratory=== Alleviates asthma, bronchitis, catarrh, laryngitis, sinusitis and coughs. ===Sexual=== Works against sexual dysfunction. ==Caution== Don't use nutmeg oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Nutmeg}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Palmarosa

revision.text: [[File:PalmarosaEssentialOil.png|right|150px|Bottle of palmarosa oil]] ;Palmarosa (''Cymbopogon martinii'') Palmarosa oil comes from the leaves of the ''Cymbopogon martinii'' grass. It has a floral scent. It has an antiseptic effect. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and nervousness. Calms and uplifts the mind. ===Pain=== Relieves muscle pain and stiffness. ===Skin=== Improves [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Acne|acne]], dermatitis, athlete's foot, oily skin and dry skin. {{Wikipedia|Cymbopogon martinii}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Spikenard

revision.text: [[File:Nardostachys grandiflora.jpg|right|150px|Spikenard plant]] ;Spikenard (''Nardostachys jatamansi'') Spikenard oil comes from the rhizome of the ''Nardostachys jatamansi'' plant. It has a floral scent. It has an antiseptic and sedative effect. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes stress and tension. ===Skin=== Improves rashes and the effects of aging. {{Wikipedia|Spikenard}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rosewood

revision.text: [[File:RosewoodEssentialOil.png|right|150px|Bottle of rosewood oil]] ;Rosewood (''Aniba rosaeodora'') Rosewood (or Bois-de-rose) oil comes from the wood of the ''Aniba rosaeodora'' plant. It has a spicy floral scent. It has an analgesic and uplifting effect. ==Properties== ===Emotional=== Soothes [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]] and uplifts the mind. ===Immunological=== Boosts the immune system and fights colds. ===Sexual=== Acts as an aphrodisiac. ===Skin=== Helps skin regeneration and improves oily skin. {{Wikipedia|Aniba rosaeodora}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}

page.title: Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of essential oils/Rose Geranium

revision.text: [[File:Rose Geranium.jpg|right|200px|Rose geranium flower]] ;Rose Geranium (''Pelargonium graveolens'') Rose Geranium oil comes from the leaves and stalks of the ''Pelargonium graveolens'' plant. It has a sweet floral scent. It has antiseptic and antidepressant effects. ==Properties== ===Circulatory=== Balances the whole body and reduces water retention. ===Emotional=== Soothes stress, anxiety and [[Complete Guide to Essential Oils/A to Z of ailments/Depression|depression]]. ===Gynecological=== Relieves symptoms of premenstrual syndrome. ===Skin=== Improves oily skin and promotes the healing of burns and wounds. ==Caution== *Don't use rose geranium oil during pregnancy. {{Wikipedia|Pelargonium graveolens}} {{BookCat|filing=deep}}
